reviewText: This movie is a wonderfully fun Christmas time! We watch it every Christmas season. The plot is predictable but a young Thora Birch is an excellent asset. The comedy is fresh and the belly laughs are numerous. Lauren Bacall gives an excellent performance as Grandma. Children will love it and adults will appreciate the humor. It is a modern day Christmas classic.

reviewText: I loved this movie so much when I was a kid.  It is one that I watch every Christmas.  Two siblings want their divorced parents to get back together for Christmas.  Big brother doesn't want to leave it up to Santa and comes up with his own plan.  Insanity ensues, of course.  It is simply a cute story.  Exactly what a Christmas movie should be.  Make hot chocolate, pop corn, grab a blanket and snuggle up with your kids.  Bright, warm, funny, innocent.  It will become a family tradition.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "All I Want For Christmas" was uniformly trashed by critics when it came out. It was easily one of the worst reviewed films of 1991. Why oh why didn't I listen to them?The plot is so generic that you know how it's going to end within the first ten minutes. Two parents are no longer together. The mother has found a new boyfriend. The kids do what they can to ditch the new boyfriend and get the parents back together. With that stale of a plot, the only way it could've worked out would have been if the acting was filled with passion and the direction evoked as much Christmas magic as possible. That didn't happen.There is not a single heartfelt moment to be found in this film. Not one. I don't even know where to begin. Thora Birch has turned out to be an impressive actress. However, she is only grating and precocious to the extreme in "All I Want For Christmas". Her brother, played by Ethan Embry, had no character definition whatsoever. His substory involving a teenage romance was underdeveloped and seemed better suited for another film.The adult characters are just as bad. The filmmakers could've saved money by utilizing cardboard cutouts instead of actual actors. The Mom, Dad, and Mom's new "jerk" boyfriend are shallower than a kiddie pool.I was even put off by the shameless plugging of Ben & Jerry's ice cream. It's a sad fact that product placement has been commonplace for a long time now but...come on! Don't they understand that if the product is shoved in your face that it only serves as an unpleasant distraction? At least their Coca-Cola placement was slightly less obvious.Even Santa would only give this movie to the naughty kids.
summary: As fun as being trampled by Santa's reindeer.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A little girl (Thora Birch), the only thing, she wants for Christmas is her Divorced Mother (Harley Jane Kozak) and her Father (Jamey Sheridan) to get back together from the help of a Department-Store Santa (Leslie Nielsen).Directed by Robert Lieberman made a Charming Dramatic Comedy by Rediscoving Love. Good Supporting Performances by Ehtan Embry, Lauren Bacall & Kevin Nealon. Birch (American Beauty, Ghost World) is the Real-Light of this film.

reviewText: I don't understand reviewers. Perhaps they see too many films and feel they have to say something unpleasant. This film is one that can be watched over and over. It is particularly nice to have a good family film like this  available at the holidays when things are getting hectic and you just need  to relax and enjoy something. reviewText: I love Christmas movies and was excited to find this one last year. I had never seen it before, but judging from the reviews I guess I expected more. I can think of so many holiday movies with more interesting storylines and more appealing characters. I can see that it would be appealing to preteens. I guess I've grown tired of scheming kids in movies and though I had no sympathy for the mother's boyfriend, I was not really entertained by their plot that hijacked him in an ice cream truck and had his car towed away. I love a great holiday comedy, but when I think of the really great ones, I can't say that this one comes close. I would have given it 2 1/2 stars if I could, because I like Lauren Bacall.I just watched it again this week to see if it was any better than I thought it was last year. My copy is going to be donated to a local thrift store. I don't think I need to see it again.
summary: Not All I want For Christmas

reviewText: Although diabetics should approach this film cautiously, one can't help but be enamored with this family film focusing on two youngsters who want their divorced parents to reunite for Christmas.  There are no real surprises here and the ending is unavoidable, and there is even a schmaltzy ballad by Stephen Bishop.  BUT ALL I WANT FOR CHRISTMAS is entertaining and the relationship between the brother and sister is refreshingly real and touching.  Ethan Randall (soon to be Ethan Embry) and Thora Birch are delightful as the kids, and Harley Jane Kozak and Jamey Sheridan gamely flesh out the stereotypical parents.  Lauren Bacall is added for class value and an uncredited Leslie Nielsen appears as a jolly Macy's Santa.  It's sweet and sentimental but still a Christmas movie the whole family should enjoy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I missed this Christmas themed movie when it was in the cinemas and like the recent "The Preacher's Wife", have only discovered it in recent years on our seasonal Christmas programming. While the story of "All I Want for Christmas", is on the light and fluffy side it does tackle the serious issue of separation and divorce and the effect it has on the children when a marriage breaks up. Of course it is treated in a fairly simplistic manner in the screenplay with a highly unlikely conclusion however the sheer likeability of the child performers and with the presense of the wonderful Leslie Neilson again playing Santa Claus (as in the delightful "Santa Who?") the improbable story takes on a charm all its own. Added to that New York in a snow covered winter and the presense of veteran actress Lauren Bacall as the children's sassy matchmaking grandmother and you are guarenteed a warm family comedy which gives you a nice feeling in the Christmas season.
summary: Innocent Family Christmas Tale With Simple Message To Enjoy

reviewText: I can't imagine anyone saying this movie is anything but great! First of all, it's set in New York City at Christmastime, so how can it go wrong? Then it's about a family with problems...and yields a happy ending. The characters are great. The story is a good one. And at the very core, it may even make a few parents think twice about what they are about to do. This is a definite must see for everyone - and, for us, it has become part of our family Christmas traditions.

reviewText: Is this a classic Christmas movie like Miracle on 34th Street or A Christmas Story?  No...not even close.  But neither is it the worst Christmas movie ever made as some have proclaimed.  Anyone who thinks so obviously has never seen "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians"The basic plot is about two kids, Ethan & Hallie played by Ethan Embry (Dutch) and Thora Birch respectively.  All they want for Christmas is to spend the holiday with their divorced parents (Harley Jane Kozak & Jamey Sheridan) and hopefully get them back together.  But their mom is all set to marry snotty yuppie Tony played by SNL alum Kevin Nealon.So they not only have to find a way to break up the new relationship, but also find a way to get their parents to rekindle their old flame.  Along the way they enlist the aid of Santa claus played by Leslie Nielsen.  The movie also features Lauren Bacall as the kid's grandmother.It's pretty standard formula stuff. but the kids are cute and mean well and there's some genuine sincerity in the movie, if not a bit of holiday magic.  You could do much worse than this if you're looking for a holiday film to watch with the kids.
summary: NOT GREAT BUT BETTER THAN SOME THINK
